page.title: 05A TEACHER'S VIEW WOODINGDEAN
page.content: Travelling into work to Woodingdean is almost impossible without a car.Driving into the area in winter,is frequently hazardous,and when it snows,Woodingdean becomes very quickly cut off. An "outsiders'" view of Woodingdean is that the area is very much part of Brighton,but the people of Woodingdean feel that they are a village community. It is frequently windy,Woodingdean being about four hundred feet above sea level,and the sea breezes often carry heavy mist over the area.Games lessons often have to be moved indoors,when schools in sheltered areas are enjoying pleasant weather. The views that most residents enjoy from their windows and gardens,of sea,downs and the town of Brighton,and its racecourse are breathtaking.
